**Heavenly Wind Peak**
The heavenly wind sweeps away the black gauze cap—
Donning court robes, he hastens to the purple court to pay homage.

**Purple Mustard Cloud Peak**
The immortals’ dharma-rain rises from Penglai,
Spreading inch by inch across the nine realms.
All mountains and rivers beneath heaven emerge from here,
Gathering in this moment of celestial celebration.

**Three Dou Rock**
The cauldron’s stone clefts cradle towering crags—
Beneath the moon, who shares a cup with me?
Could this be the day Prince Ruyang drank to excess,
Leaving his wine gourd behind on his way to court?

**Hidden Cloud Rock**
Though riding the dragon is fine, remain concealed,
Five-colored light veiled within the embroidered valley.
Even with intent, do not leave the mountain’s embrace—
Await the timely spring rains borne on the wind.

**Great Bright Mountain**
A sacred realm of pure yang, nurturing Qian’s essence,
Auspicious radiance shines boundless in all directions.
Neither dawn nor dusk—here, heaven and earth differ,
For it is ever the midday sun at the central street.

**Twisted Tooth Peak**
Abrupt as an ancient tree rooted in jagged heights,
Spring’s arrival brings forth teeming life.
Hew a branch with the thunder spirit’s axe,
And ascend with the immortals to the Milky Way.

**Gathering Cloud Peak**
Auspicious vapors float in kindred formation,
The Celestial Perfected ride upon divine dragons.
Exotic fragrance billows atop the numinous peak,
As ten thousand sages come to pay homage to the nine-tiered heavens.

**Cinnabar Rock**
The alchemical furnace refines the elixir to perfection,
Nurturing a fiery tree of radiant spirit.
The immortals crush it in a golden mortar,
And the cosmos revives—all things bask in spring’s yang.

**Brow-Ridge Mountain**
An ancient reclusive official, upright and incorruptible,
His dwelling as luminous as Yuan Lu Mountain.
Enraged to see Yuan Gui’s face dust-laden,
He widens his eyes to question the world.

**Subduing Demons Peak**
The heavenly gate, a mere footspan away, has transformed into a fish—
Yet it leaps with ease, moving in unhurried grace.
There is no need to seek the Chancellor in Longzhong,
For Zhuge now dwells here in this place.

**Master Yu’s Rock**
The mountain elder adores dwelling in emerald peaks,
His domain by the rivers nurturing purple lingzhi.
Bearing the *Hetu* in his back, the divine *Yi* departs,
Perhaps he has journeyed since antiquity to seek Fu Xi.

**Parrot Peak**
A mortal bird, now immortal, dwells in azure clouds,
Claiming a lofty perch far above the common throng.
At the break of dawn in the grotto-heaven, it precedes the world,
Its great vessel and resounding voice known across the earth.

**Ever-Spring Rock**
The valley brims with immortal blossoms, brocade-lush,
Their fragrance unbroken through the four seasons, celestial sweet.
The Celestial Perfected expand life’s boundless creation—
A single grain of elixir revives the cosmos’ yang.

**Solitary Yang Rock**
At first light, it sketches the precelestial design,
Every mountain embodying the *Gen* trigram’s form.
Those who cultivate fire—how vast their heaven!
Their bone and power, pure yang, are unmatched.

**Favor Gate Mountain**
Purchasing cassia to fuel the stove at the summit,
Smoke towers rise, commanding the gaze of all.
When the Han king arrived, his robes caught flame,
Igniting the mid-heaven’s fiery virtue.

**Hand-Climbed Mountain**
The waters are shallow, Penglai’s cloud-path distant,
Yet immortals gather here to ride the heavenly bridge.
Together, they stretch out Ma Gu’s claws,
Clambering to the peak’s crest—there lies the azure sky.

**Yin Xi’s Rock**
Where the Dao conceals itself, immortals abide,
The heart-seal at the Han Pass, the *Dao De Jing*.
No need to knock on the gate and ride a crane away—
This mountain’s immortals are already in heaven’s court.

**Stalwart Man Peak**
Jian Hai strides boldly across the nine provinces,
For millennia, he has stood at the vanguard of creation.
Enraged, he severs Ao’s legs, clashes with Gong Gong,
Bracing the northwest corner of the sky.

**Outer Cloud Rock**
Leaving the mountain, he stumbles into dragon-riding,
Returning from rain-bestowing, his sleep is deep.
Let Master Xi Yi stretch his limbs at ease—
No worry his dream will fail to reach the Shang lord.

**Cloud-Mist Rock**
Hidden leopards, concealed dragons, auspicious vapors rise,
True immortals dwell here, their spirits at home.
Their carriages come and go without form,
One imagines pavilions merging with the ethereal void.

**Dripping Water Rock**
The golden lock taps softly, channeling the Milky Way,
A silver thread hangs, abundant and fine.
Not to withhold the rain’s key in stubborn closure—
The jade cliffs shift, stones stir, winds and waves arise.

**Great Green Sheep Gully**
The water’s pulse connects to the Luo Grotto,
The stream brims with strange stones—torpid dragons.
The earth immortals’ nine halls are not far,
Their root-realm comes to pay homage to the nine-tiered heavens.

**Small Green Sheep Gully**
The Dongting shepherd resents his lifelong duty,
Though the dragon maiden is divine, she has not attained true spirit.
Purifying himself, he drives them forth to seek enlightenment,
Yet his steadfast heart turns to stone, neighbor to stone.

**Resting Immortals’ Rock**
Riding qi and wind, they traverse the ten thousand heavens,
The assembled Perfected till the clouds by day and night.
Pausing their jade pendants in the Jasper Flower Grotto,
They recline at a feast of flying cups on a tortoiseshell mat.

**Early Worm Peak**
The Dark Heaven’s ancient might commands awe,
At its summit, the Black Killer’s banner flies high.
No need for the great god’s twin arms—
The winds and clouds on all sides sustain it forever.

**Master Xi Yi’s Rock**
The immortals’ wondrous method is transmitted heart-to-heart,
Dream-sated on mist and rosy clouds, he sleeps with the peaks.
Pushing aside his pillow, he surveys the world’s affairs,
Then moves his couch amid the clouds to Hua Mountain’s crest.

**Scattered Stones Peak**
Chu Ping delves deep into azure mists,
Leaving behind his flock of sheep for years.
If their true nature were touched by immortal alchemy,
The slow mountains’ glow would all turn to cinnabar.

**Immortal Singers’ Rock**
Mist and rosy clouds—old friends to one another,
Playing with the moon, chanting to the wind, they share a home.
Atop the great summit, the heavenly path draws near,
They come and go together in five-colored cloud chariots.

**Jade Immortal Rock**
The golden crucible tames coiling dragons and tigers,
The immortal’s recipe—pine and citron—is the heart’s elixir.
When the grotto gate’s lock opens to the clouds,
A myriad miles of flying cranes widen the cosmos.

**Subduing Demons Peak**
Steep cliffs, verdant heights, stone swords piercing the sky,
The Celestial Perfected’s karmic mandate guards the sacred altar.
The Dragon Spring is sealed within a golden lotus casket,
Its unshining radiance chills the demons’ hearts.

**Yang Harmony Peak**
A single sacred sprout stirs purple mist,
The earth’s essence warms, lush as Lantian’s fields.
The Daoist’s primordial qi is wrapped in spring’s rebirth,
The entire valley plows white clouds at noon.

**Cloud-Rosy Abbey**
Several strands of golden light, their hues resplendent,
Jade pendants flutter as ten thousand immortals descend.
Where the five dragons alight in ordered ranks,
A new, secluded grotto-heaven of vast yang is created.

**Dragon Pool**
Half a deep pool stilled, brimming with Yu Gate’s waves,
Its location ordained for a celestial gathering.
Awaiting the nine heavens’ thunderous roar,
It will surge straight up to the azure clouds.

**Thunder Grotto**
Nurturing the precelestial, restoring earth’s yang,
The Heavenly Lord rides the jade dragon in concealment.
Within, the axis of heaven and earth turns,
A single ladle of numinous spring rains the eight wilds.

**Southern Rock (Renamed: Celestial Yi’s True Blessing, Longevity Palace)**
Unlocking heaven’s treasury, expanding the sacred realm,
Pure yang immortals occupy pure yang’s domain.
Clouds and rosy mists, jade hues—beyond the mortal world,
Their radiant flames illuminate the entire earth.

Hand grasping wind and thunder, he establishes the teaching’s gate,
Divine and human merge to devise wondrous merit.
Lofty pavilions pierce the sky, his body bears the weight,
In this world’s ascension, he conceals the clouds of the ridge.

**Sweet Dew Spring**
Jade well’s abyss, deep with rippling green,
The Celestial Perfected’s primordial sun refines the elixir pool.
Its waters, fragrant through the ages, are all celestial wine—
May the drowned be cured, drinking but a single cup.

**Celestial Bridge**
From the hanging cliff, cascades plunge to the peak’s waist,
Entering cultivation here, one already soars the nine heavens.
Humans too build suspended walkways linking towering halls,
Gazing ahead, each step spans ten thousand leagues.

**Three Halls of Southern Rock**
The Sage Emperor’s western retinue, the Sage Friends gather,
The Sacred Parents’ throne stands at the center.
Left and right, incense clouds coil and billow,
The Celestial Yi’s Purple Tenuity True Blessing Palace.

**Shrine of the Southern Rock Perfected**
The Great Summit looms before all eyes,
Streams and mountains encircle its emerald, facing the peak’s tip.
Wudang’s marvels, the marvel of marvels—
At first glance, the celestial Perfected dwell beneath the eaves.

Myriad ravines and cliffs gather the essence of beauty,
Its solemnity needs no ritual form.
Say not that gods and spirits truly reside here—
Even wood and earth, lifeless, radiate numinous power.

**Southern Rock’s Sea Convergence**
How compare tripods to the furnace of water and fire?
Nobles joyfully offer alms, entering the Mystic Capital.
The Patriarch convenes to transmit the mind-seal,
Each bestows the talisman of ascension and celestial mandate.

**Abiding Immortal’s Reclusion**
Golden abyss, jade sea swell with literary waves,
The eighth-month sky’s winds ride the ocean’s heights.
Heroic qi gathers within clouds and ravines—
From the immortal isles, he strides a golden turtle.

**Trial Heart Stone**
The world’s human sentiments are treacherous as iron,

Walk the Way with ease, though the crags be hollow—
Ten thousand fathoms deep is no peril.

**Ascension Terrace**
For long, his spirit descended before the Emperor,

From the layered cliffs, he casts off his dust-laden body,

Momentarily moved by the vault of heaven, speechless,

Freely roaming as a spirit, attending the Jade Clarity.

Immortal dwellings stretch across verdant peaks,
Ridge clouds probe the locks of layered green.
Within the grotto, heaven and earth are vast from the start—
A fiefdom’s households all find ample space.

**Ox Ford Gorge**
Of old, the Old Lord crossed the Hangu Pass,
Riding a green ox, he passed this way.
Now, as the Dragon-Horse appears in the revealed diagram,
Daoists play with the *Yijing* by murmuring streams.

**Azure Sheep Gorge**
For a thousand years, incense and verse recall Xie’s Pool,
A single line from the Western Hall—a dreamt poem.
Rooted in duckweed and pondweed for offerings,
It transcends to the flourishing age of the royal *feng*.

**Imperial Cliff Peak**
The earth’s weight shifts, yet it remains serene and focused,
The Dao’s words correspond above to the Great Peace Heaven.
Hollowed eaves and golden goblets encircle golden palaces,
Neither existing nor void, at the vast desert’s edge.

**Manifest Stability Peak**
It forbids the great yawn to shake heaven’s pivot,
The grand cosmos

**Purple Void Crag**
At Qian and Dui’s sunlit highest peak,
The dragon-vein coils five myriad leagues.
Heaven’s first abode for cultivating truth,
A yard’s breadth holds ninefold imperial depths.

**Great Harmony Crag**
Myriad ravines and cliffs bloom in wondrous splendor,
Yet here remains the ancient harmony of Yong.
A plot of the Old Master’s springtime terrace,
Ever abiding in the flourishing age of Tang and Yu.

**Crown Prince Crag**
Cliff and ravine, dark and deep,
The royal heir pressed on to learn immortal arts.
Ascending through the ages as the Mysterious Heavenly Emperor,
How many kings of former dynasties matched his years?

**Cloud-Gazing Peak**
Clouds drift from peaks without intent—yet they exist,
Heaven and Earth bestow their grace to the eight directions.
In the towering ravines, a spontaneous joy arises,
At the summit, one burns incense and sits to watch.

**Verdant Cloud Crag**
Worldly affairs shift and twist with deceit,
White robes and gray dogs change in an instant.
Yet a single green qi floats through the ages,
Vaguely recalling the Mercy Palace’s boundless reach.

**Longevity Palace**
Golden crucible, elixir void—dragon and tiger grow cold,
This pine, hollow with age, guards the immortal altar.
When shall the Penglai Hall open once more,
To gaze at the five-colored clouds and pray for peace?

**Summit-Gazing Peak**
Human worth varies on these purple-green heights,
Yet all revere this place where scholars seek worthiness.
The foremost peak aspires to sagehood,
But only Heaven stands beyond all comparison.

**Return-to-Court Peak**
Sleeves filled with celestial fragrance, stepping from the palace gate,
Delighted to join the Queen Mother’s feast in the Western Kunlun.
Still, the heart clings to the court with loyal devotion,
Rushing to join the morning assembly before the August One.

**Grand Constancy Office**
Offerings and counsel dwell beside sun and moon,
Yi and Kui’s rites and music align with Shun’s ranks.
The White Cloud Office guards the White Cloud Grotto,
Its earthly place in the sacred mountain, its duty in Heaven.

**Protector-Sage Office**
Holding Heaven’s northern pole, the office of the celestial pivot,
The Northern Pole’s pivot court bears the same charge.
Thunder and lightning rush forth at its commands,
How many secret scriptures of the Three Realms pass through?

**Harmonious Relocation and Examination Office**
Two inquiries mold the myriad beings as one,
The registers of perfected immortals receive imperial favor.
When the Celestial Court convenes to review merits,
All in Jade Capital Heaven answer to Kui and Gao.

**Celestial Unity and True Felicity Palace**
The Emperor’s residence atop Kan, within the Purple Tenuity,
The four seas divide its spirit into ten thousand streams.
A single pulse of primordial qi gives rise to living waters,
Ten thousand years of rain and dew bestow Heaven’s grace.

**Martial Majesty King’s Temple**
Born with solemn resolve, yearning for the mysterious,
Graced by karmic favor to guard the sacred mountain.
Silent, formless, beyond sound in the darkest depths,
Yet thunder, lightning, wind, and storm answer to his gaze.

**Cloud Grotto Hermitage**
Which tier of the sacred mountain’s retreat is this?
A thatched hut, tightly sealed, concealing its traces.
Deep within the shadowed vale, coiled and hidden,
Perhaps in a former life, it was the Five Dragons.

**Purple Empyrean Spirit Spring**
Half a pool beneath the stone, a small hill’s embrace,
The sea’s dust scatters, yet its flow never ceases.
Each drop sustains thousands upon thousands,
Divine workings transform countless autumn pools.

**Nine-Ford Stream**
The crane’s chariot drifts far, never to return,
The heir apparent ascends to the White Cloud Mountain.
How could a mere stream block the path to a mother’s love?
Awaiting the day he faces the Celestial Countenance in Heaven’s Palace.

**Nine-Wave Service**
Jade blossoms hang suspended over the emerald creek’s bend,
How many times has its radiance graced these waters?
A single handful of brewed spring brings a thousand days of drunkenness,
Even the old sojourner of Xinfeng regains a youthful face.

**Banner-Unfurling Peak**
Seven crags arrayed like stars, towering and majestic,
Great banners and lofty standards escort the Six Dragons.
Scattered to fill the Six Directions,
Raising wind and felling rain, its celestial might resounds.

**Millennial Mugwort**
The mountain holds divine spirit, and its herbs share its power,
A single pill’s strength rivals ginseng and poria.
Branch by branch, leaf by leaf, it governs human fate,
Heaven dwells at its roots, granting eternal life.

**Ten-Thousand-Year Pine**
Heaven’s essence and Earth’s purity merge in the wilds,
Not in lofty grandeur to rival the Han’s heights.
In an instant, withered wood revives through transformation,
Unaging through wind and frost, its root of longevity firm.

**Golden Star Stone**
Its qi pure and unyielding, wondrously congealed,
The Western Venus radiates auspicious light.
Its scattered brilliance fills Heaven and Earth,
Mount Hua’s treasures flourish in its mountain.

**Silver Star Stone**
Once carved as tribute to Liangzhou,
It remains to guard the sacred mountain’s highest peak.
Grain by grain, cinnabar—a treasure of the world,
Its auspicious glow illuminates the night sky.

**Pine Lichen**
Ten thousand strands of trailing silk drape the green mist,
For millennia, it sways and coils.
Fully transformed, it robes the court in splendor,
Adorning the Golden Gate across ten thousand heavens.

**Non-Empty Bird**
The Daoist lineage of Zhuang and Lao studies emptiness,
Yet diligently doing good, it follows Shun’s path.
Observe that bird—its meaning lies beyond words,
For three thousand meritorious deeds are true mastery.

**Crow**
At the Coming Phoenix Terrace, it emulates swift flight,
Recording offices like the phoenix at the Guest Gate.
When celestial visitors arrive, the flock calls in unison,
Leading the crane’s ranks to audience with the Sacred One.

**Half-Set Music**
The Supreme Clarity’s refined strains, rare in the world,
Neither bamboo nor silk, but five-colored birds.
The *Shao* dance shares in the universal celebration,
The numinous phoenix arrives with a single heart.

**My Master’s Bird**
The Dao is everywhere, inherent in all nature,
Every moving thing, every living being, holds reverence.
Its teaching’s work mirrors Heaven’s nurturing embrace,
Who in this life can stand apart from Heaven and Earth?

**White Pheasant Parrot**
Feathered robes of pure jade, a deity of Yizhou,
Facing east, it guards the sacred mountain’s truth.
Transformed to soar in the palace courtyard, nesting with the phoenix,
Its wings support the imperial carriage to the Celestial Ford.

**Spirit-Longevity Staff**
An ancient pine’s bones, the Valley Spirit’s elder,
The Great One’s true essence, an ancient staff’s might.
Spared the taint of Kong Guang’s treacherous hands,
Its years in the mountains match Heaven’s own.

**Kan Forest Tree**
A wondrous marvel of the Seven Treasures Forest in the upper realms,
Branch by branch, kingfisher jade, leaf by leaf, lapis lazuli.
Had it not dwelled atop the Great Summit in Heaven,
How could its divine root claim such uniqueness?

**Mind-Stabilizing Pine**
A green official, Heaven-sent, exuding human grandeur,
A single stone, rootless, towers ten thousand feet.
Leaning like Mount Tai to peer beyond the Dipper,
Its iron body upholds an emerald canopy in the void.

**Cloud Bamboo Staff**
Bestowed in purple, concealed in forests and springs,
In times of peril, it upholds the state as a great worthy.
The world’s path is smooth, Heaven’s course steady,
Lao Ge invites it to accompany the immortals.

**Heavenly Lamp**
From yin cliffs and bottomless ravines, waters trickle,
At dusk, its windows gleam on all eight sides.
Suddenly, the Nine Empyreans’ divine transformations appear,
A few branches of flame glow in silver vats.

**Stone Lamp Core**
Inch by inch, its unyielding heart embodies the Dao’s fullness,
Boundless radiance illuminates the infinite.
Lantern oil never exhausts, its burning unceasing,
For ten thousand ages, it is the dawn of humanity’s world.

**Solomon’s Seal**
Shoots of pure yang nestle with deer in slumber,
Its roots, full and substantial, endure through the years.

**Night Furnace**
By moonlight, the golden crucible simmers,
Even plain rice, untainted by green essence, may lead to immortality.

**Cangmu Decoction**
Humble as weeds, yet precious as golden jade,
Fire forges the elixir to transmute bones and ascend.
Refined within the cauldron of creation,
The drug of longevity needs not seek Penglai.

**Black Tiger Elixir**
Majestic as a bear’s solemn march,
On wild cliffs and mountain walls, dusk lingers.
Within the spoon, fangs and claws stir,
Aching ills and pains—mere tricks of the black donkey.

**Chuanxiong Cakes**
Sharp attacks on head and eyes, bitter with hollow pain,
The immortal’s remedy wields mighty force.
Flake by flake, snow-like blooms from Shu’s finest,
No need for ablutions or the Three Vehicles’ discourse.

**Mugwort-Essence Pill**
Amid thorny thickets lie ginseng and poria,
The emperor’s tribute, blessed by earth’s spirit.
Though seven years of true illness may persist,
The mercury furnace’s merit blazes in cinnabar script.

**Sweet Tea**
Cultivating the Dao, its taste is plain yet divine,
Self-cultivated cloud-fat, plucked jade blossoms.
Since ancient times, it has sweetened mortal lips,
A spring breeze for a hundred million lives.

**Wudang Illustrated Scroll**
Ascend ninefold skies to witness great harmony,
Spiral through eight hundred li of mountains and rivers.
A thousand verses of brocade could not exhaust its splendor,
Yet a single painted scroll—does it suffice?

Moments of wind and moon take on new grace,
How do mist and clouds shift in their forms?
To see beyond the scroll itself,
Is to find the mountains’ endless vistas.
